result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas D Wiemerslage

records.addlTxt: Court takes no action; directs letter be scanned to both Thomas Wiemerslage & James Stewart cases.

10:37 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Thomas D Wiemerslage appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Thomas D Wiemerslage.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards wishes to proceed to preliminary hearing

1W -CASEY COX - Sworn by Court
exam. by Atty. Steiner
cross exam. by Atty. Richards
redirect by Atty. Steiner

Atty. Richards states he filed a subpoena for James Stewart.
Court advises that the document did not come across correctly on the e-file system, however she will have bailiff get Mr. Stewart from the jail
Court to reject document as filed, and Atty Richards will re-file the subpoena.

2W - JAMES STEWART - Sworn by Court
court advises witness that any testimony that may incriminate him he can refuse to answer.
Def. invokes his 5th amendment privileges
comments Atty. Richards- he is going to ask question, if def. invokes the 5th amendment, we will take if from there
exam by Atty. Richards
def. invokes 5th amendment rights at this time and refuses to answer any further questions.
Court excuses witness


State requests defendant to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty. Richards will let court make the ruling

Court finds probable cause and binds def. over for further proceedings. 

Atty Richards is prepared to proceed to arraignment today (requests  this matter be set for same date as 22CM54, 12-01-2022 ) 
Information filed

Atty. RIchards waives reading - NOT GUILTY pleas to be entered to all 3 cts.
Court directs clerk to enter NOT GUILTY pleas to all 3 cts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall have no contact with JS. Defendant shall have no contact with the apartments located at 126 E. Blackhawk Avenue, Prairie du Chien, WI. Defendant shall have no contact with TLP.

10:38 AM Defendant Thomas D Wiemerslage appeared by video.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Thomas D Wiemerslage.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.   

Attorney Richards is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond. 
State opposes a reduction to a signature bond. 

Court orders bond to be cut in half, modifies bon to a $750.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with JS. Defendant shall have no contact with the apartments located at 126 E. Blackhawk Avenue. Defendant shall have no contact with TLP.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:20 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas D Wiemerslage Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with JS. Defendant shall have no contact with the apartments located at 126 E. Blackhawk Avenue.  

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $1,500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with JS. Defendant shall have no contact with the apartments located at 126 E. Blackhawk Avenue.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant shall have no contact with JS. Defendant shall have no contact with the apartments located at 126 E. Blackhawk Avenue.
